snippet: Over the next week and a half, musicians will take part in Jazzrael, a festival of jazz and world music presented by the Israeli Consulate in New York.
abstract: Nate Chinen comments that Jazzrael, a upcoming festival of jazz and world music presented by the Israeli Consulate in New York City, highlights how much Israel has influenced the global jazz scene over the past 15 years. Photo (M)c
lead_paragraph: The proposition that jazz is a global language, spanning continents and cultures, has been a reliable diplomatic device for so many years that it now has the ring of a banality. ''Jazz became the world's music long ago,'' said Susan E. Rice, the United States ambassador to the United Nations, in that organization's General Assembly hall on Monday night. ''There is by now a rich tradition of Nordic jazz. There's South Asian jazz, there's Russian jazz and Chinese jazz.''

headline.main: From Israel, a United Nations of Jazz
